results.title: Lights, Camera, Los Angeles
results.creator_credit: Jim Settlemoir, Robert F. Gingg and Candlelight Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Discover L.A.’s earliest beginnings at Mission San Gabriel and the busy market place on Olvera Street. Experience the renaissance of downtown L.A. at the Music Centre and Museum of Contemporary Art. We see the Rose Bowl and Pasadena’s Huntington Gardens. Have fun at the famous amusement parks and Griffith Park, then hello to Hollywood and all that glitters!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Settlemoir, Robert F. Gingg and Candlelight Associates

results.title: Lights, camera, action: Supergeek (August 2006)
results.brief_description: In this story the ACMI Screen Pit becomes a Sunridge High classroom. Oscar from Short Cuts is auditioning for roles in his latest film ‘Super Geek 2’. He tries to get the Short Cuts kids to do it but has no luck, so he turns to the ‘new class’ for help. Produced in Melbourne and screened on the Seven Network, Short Cuts is a terrific local TV series set in a Year 9 Media Studies class. Short Cuts’ stories explore how the video camera can be a tool of expression, exploration and communication - and also of manipulation, secrecy and lies. Slowly, the characters find ways of using the camera and in the process, find out more about themselves, each other, their friends, their families and the world.

results.title: Lights, action, Africa!
results.creator_credit: Alan Root, Survival Anglia Ltd and Harry Aldous
results.brief_description: Two of the most famous African wildlife filmmakers, Joan and Alan Root show the excitement and danger involved in filming wild animals. Spitting cobras, galloping herds of animals and nervous hippos all make this film a tribute to the courage and genius of the Roots.

results.title: Lights that never fail
results.brief_description: At an international conference in London, men of many nations are seen as they meet to discuss the problems of safeguarding life at sea. The film then shows the work of the men who keep the lighthouses, and how their faithful attention to duty protects people of different countries and of all races.

results.title: Lightning Jack
results.creator_credit: Lightning Ridge, Village Roadshow Pictures, Paul Hogan, Greg Coote and Simon Wincer
results.brief_description: Paul Hogan is Lightning Jack Kane, an outlaw of legendary status, a bank robber who can shoot the eye out of a needle at 50 paces, a gunfighter quicker on the draw than Wyatt Earp and Doc Holliday - if only everyone else knew it! Co-starring Cuba Gooding Jnr as his mute sidekick and Beverly D’Angelo as the sultry saloon Madam, this is a comedy about two outlaws who just wanted to be wanted. This film is unique as it was the first Hollywood production to be floated on the stock market to raise the necessary production funds, with investors reaping a percentage of the profits, which unfortunately were not as much as expected.

results.title: Lighting on location
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Larry Boehlins, an experienced “gaffer” covers key points such as: sources of power, hook up, the use of filters on lights and cameras, polaroid filters, window diffusion, use of reflectors etc. The film introduces a variety of grip equipment.

results.title: Lighting for television
results.creator_credit: Mavis Lock and Centre for Educational Television Overseas
results.brief_description: An introduction to the problems and possibilities of television lighting, including the techniques of three and four point lighting. The base lighting of a face is analysed by means of a miniature studio. The problems of contrast lighting and the translation of color into black and white are dealt with, and the need for the producer’s cooperation is stressed.

results.title: Lighted windows: the story of a senior scout troop
results.creator_credit: Carol Hale, Girl Scouts of the USA and William S Resnick
results.brief_description: How a group of Senior Girl Scouts re-opened schools for after hour activities. The Senior Scout Planning Board initiates a survey that reveals a lack of recreational facilities throughout the city. Facts and figures are placed before community leaders and eventually the entire city becomes interested in the situation and a referendum is held. Suggests that individuals develop their personalities through team work and responsibility.
